org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class ExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.ExceptionHandler

public class ExceptionHandler
extends Object

The class ExceptionHandler provides a way for handling all the exceptions that are thrown by the application. Based on the mode selected, the output is written to standard error, or in interactive mode it is displayed as a dialog box, or in quiet mode it is written to the specified log appender

Written:

Copyright (C) 2001, The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR).

All rights reserved. 

  * $RCSfile$

Author:
Sreenath Nampally

Constant Field Values

mode

private static int mode
The variable mode holds the current mode for the application. The default is standard mode which sens exception messages to the STDERR.

Constructor Detail

ExceptionHandler

Method Detail

handleException

public static void handleException(Throwable e)
The handleException method uses the currently configured method to log the exception messages. For STANDARD_MODE the messages are sent to console, in QUEIT_MODE the messages are sent to the error stream, in INTERACTIVE_MODE dialog boxes are used to log the messages

Parameters:
e - an Exception that needs to be processed

handleException

public static void handleException(String message,
                                   Throwable e)
The handleException method uses the currently configured method to log the exception messages. For STANDARD_MODE the messages are sent to console, in QUEIT_MODE the messages are sent to the error stream, in INTERACTIVE_MODE dialog boxes are used to log the messages

Parameters:
message - a String value for an additional message that is prepended to the exception message.
e - an Exception that needs to be processed

public static int getMode()
The getMode method returns the current error handling mode.

handleExceptionStandardMode

private static void handleExceptionStandardMode(String message,
                                                Throwable e)
The handleExceptionStandardMode method is called when the error handling is set to STANDARD_MODE. In the mode the messages are sent to the standard error

Parameters:
message - a String value for an additional message that is prepended to the exception message.
e - an Exception that needs to be handled

Parameters:

handleExceptionInteractiveMode

private static void handleExceptionInteractiveMode(String message,
                                                   Throwable e)
The handleExceptionInteractiveMode method is called when the error handling is set to INTERACTIVE_MODE. In this mode dialog boxes are used to display error messages.

Parameters:
message - a String value for an additional message that is prepended to the exception message.
e - an Exception that needs to be handled

handleExceptionInteractiveMode

private static void handleExceptionInteractiveMode(Throwable e)
The handleExceptionInteractiveMode method is called when the error handling is set to INTERACTIVE_MODE. In this mode dialog boxes are used to display error messages.

Parameters:
e - an Exception that needs to be handled

buildMessage

public static String buildMessage(Throwable e)
The buildMessage method ferrets out the exception messages by looking for nested exceptions if any.

Parameters:
e - an Exception that is to be processed
Returns:
a String built by concanetating the messages from the exception and any nested exceptions
